Maybe it's just me... I read this comment several times, but am not able to figure out what it means. It seems that (google)translate did a bad job here. Can anyone help me understanding that comment? https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4941#issuecomment-797806110

[UX] Manage blocks interface cannot be used with keyboard navigation 路 Issue #4941 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug We received an email today from someone who is struggling with the manage blocks interface because they can not see. (The following is from a non-English speaker) Hi. I can n...

Here's how I'm reading that comment @indigoxela :

  • "Let's create a special block." -> "When creating a custom block"...
  • The configuration of this block is very limited. It cannot be configured without going to the layouts page and adding it to a region. (this makes sense as is)
  • "For example, if the block is only shown on certain pages." -> "Let's assume that the block needs to be shown only on specific pages"
  • "For example, the contract will be added to the user registration form." - > They need a "contract" or "terms of use" piece of text to be shown in the user registration page, in the form of a custom block.
  • "I can't do this directly in the custom block insertion area." -> they mean that there is now way to add the block to a layout/page from /admin/structure/block/add
    ...sounds to me like a separate problem (so pretty much out of scope for that issue), but the person already mentioned that:

    It's not about accessibility. It's a general problem.

...so we should ask them to either create a separate issue for that, or we should create one for them, and ask them to avoid mixing discussions about other issues, as it confuses people reading the thread of comments.

...as far as the actual problem they are reporting, it is a matter of workflow I think. They have chosen to create a custom block from that dedicated form in /admin/structure/block/add, which will make that block available in the "add block" dialog, whereas they could have chosen to add that block via the block management UI on a specific layout instead :shrug: ...perhaps we can support both of these workflows?

Still struggling to understand the problem ... that it's about workflow seems reasonable to me, though. Maybe the trouble is, that they still try it "the Drupal way"?
A new issue might make sense. Hopefully we figure out in that issue, if there's something we can do code-wise to make things easier, or if support is sufficient.
Oh, and many thanks for your "translation" :wink: @klonos ++

Maybe the trouble is, that they still try it "the Drupal way"?

Yup, I think that that's the case :sweat_smile:
unfortunately, i dont understand either. hopefully he can find someone who can translate for him better than google can.
Pardon, wrong window. I'll try to help the guy.

I wish I noticed that thread long time ago. Didn't have time to have all the issues on my radar. For posterity, if any Turkish-speaking person is encountering problems in using Backdrop, just send them my way and I'll try my best to help.
